title: Suddenly cannot send emails, except in Trouble-shooting mode
creator: pigeonsontheroof
content: Hello! ... Suddenly I cannot send emails from Thunderbird. I still receive incoming emails as normal, and all other functions seem to work. But I cannot send. When I switch to Trouble-shooting mode, I can send emails, but when I switch back to regular mode, I can't send. I can save the email, but when I click "send" the send button and all the other buttons at the top of the window fade, and nothing happens. I have not changed any settings in Thunderbird or my email provider (Kolabnow). I have checked and the settings are exactly as Kolab requires: smtp.kolabnow.com .... Port 465 ... SSL/TLS. Thunderbird updates automatically, so I'm running the latest version. I'm on Mac OS 13.5.2 (Ventura). How do I fix this? Are others reporting the same problem? (I have tested and can still send emails from Kolab's web site, just not from Thunderbird.)

title: Unable to connect to my ISP email server - Thunderbird claiming wrong username/password or configuration problem
creator: pintaric
content:
Hi, I have been using Thunderbird for a long time and never had any issues until last Thursday. I was able to connect to my ISP email server but it ended up showing no new emails even though I know that I have emails as I am able to see them on my iPhone. So thinking that something changed, I removed my account details from Thunderbird and try to reconnect. The first stage, the detection of my ISP email server passed with no problems.

See the first attachment.

So after seeing this, I click on the Done button and then the problem arises.

See the second attachment.

Now to cover some other important information. I talked with my ISP and we checked the configuration manually that is shown in both attachments and they were completely correct to their files. No deviation in any manner. We trip POP3 and also IMAP settings and still got the same error as the second attachment. I and the tech support person from my ISP also checked the typing of my password, the original one and even the new password 10x. I also typed each character of my password slowly, just in case I typed it wrong having it visible to me and invisible to me and still got the same error as the second attachment. Also the images are from today January 29, 2025 approximately from the last 20 minutes. So this is fresh for an attempt to connect to my ISP email server, not just from some previous attempt.

Hopefully I can get a work around from the forum. Oh, one more thing I have the latest Mozilla Thunderbird that is available and that is Version 128.6.1esr (64-bit) as I had updated it before I attempted to connect to the ISP email server. I have done no uninstalls.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:134.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/134.0

content:
The issue: I am 20 year Outlook (Microsoft Office Outlook version and I love it) user with Comcast/Xfinity email. I no longer use Comcast (Xfinity) as the Internet Service Provider. Xfinity/Comcast lets me keep the address (for an undetermined amount of time). Our new home Internet Service Provider is AT&T.

title: Thunderbird fails to enter correct FROM address when forwarding received email as attachment. FROM address should be the one which received the mail.
creator: lkeewp
content:
When I receive email in Thunderbird software (128.6.0esr - latest stable for my distribution), right click it, select "Forward and Redirect" and then "As attachment", the FROM email address is set to my default SMTP server account email address (Edit > Account settings > scroll down to the bottom and click "Outgoing server (SMTP)" ).

On another hand when i just reply same email, it uses correct FROM address of mine (the one which received the mail). How to fix it so the Forwarding as attachment does not use my default email, but the email of mine, which received the now forwarded message?

I think that it should be default for privacy reason so TB does not help me accidentally "contaminate" my recipient identity with my main/default identity.

title: Working with collaborative Events
creator: carroll.diehl
content:
Hey everyone,

I am trying to use Thunderbird for scheduling meetings, but I have problems understanding how. Let's say, we are a group of 5 people, all using Thunderbird as their Mail driver and managing our calendars in Thunderbird. When I create an event in my calendar and hit 'Invite Attendees', it opens a Window with a timeline and a list of mail addresses. First problem here: It has the mail account, which I added to Thunderbird most recently, prefilled instead of my primary mail account or the account connected to the calendar where I add the event to. I couldn't find a place to change this. But then, when I change it to a mail address connected to my calendars, I'd expect it to populate my timeline with the events in these calendars. But it stays empty. Also, when I add other people, it stays completely empty. I wasn't able to have anything appear in this timeline at any point. Where am I going wrong? How do I add my available and unavailable times for this timeline and share them with people, who might be interest to schedule me around them? I hope I could transmit my problems, if you have any questions, I'm glad to answer them.

Thanks a lot Carroll
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:134.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/134.0

title: PDF Attachments, Comcast Email
creator: tightpurchaser
content: I hope there is a simple solution to this. This is a Mac Monterey system. Right now I am using Firefox. About three years ago I gave my State's Court system access to my Comcast email address, which syncs with Thunderbird. About two days ago I found, before I saved previously one of the attached documents, that the PDF Court initiated attachments no longer opened. I have not dismissed some kind of administrative mischief at their end on the part of some IT professional they employ. Instead of opening the document, they instead open a tab showing the message thread to which they attached the original PDF. Since these are Court documents, and their is personal injury involved, of course they are important to me. So, I am interested in recovering these documents. Does my Thunderbird, which I constantly check for updates as I do Firefox and this whole Mac Monterey system, need some kind of repair? Unfortunately, since I have a Windows 10 with Thunderbird (Microsoft no longer supporting its original Mail program), these messages do not appear in that installment of Thunderbird. These messages go back to 2022; and on the Windows 10, the oldest messages only go back to 2023. Again, I hope somebody knows a simple fix. I had A+ training from DeVry; but XP was the going OS then. Thanks in advance for anyone who has possible solutions. Have a good day, otherwise, hopefully better than mine.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:134.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/134.0

title: Read/unread status synchronization issue
creator: sebastien.boinot
content:
Hello,

Since the last Thunderbird update (128.6.1esr) installed on 28 January 2025, I have a problem with messages status synchronization. When I mark a message as read, it becomes unread again, and vice-versa. I have the same problem in troubleshooting mode.

I tried several solutions but none of them worked: - compress and repair the inbox folder - move the messages to a local subfolder, delete the 'Inbox.msf' and 'Inbox' files, reopen Thunderbird and move the messages to the new empty Inbox folder - delete and recreate my whole account

Is this a common problem caused by the latest update?

Kind regards

title: Attachment Problems, Comcast Email
creator: tightpurchaser
content: My original post earlier today unfortunately does not allow editing after posting. So, I had to start a new thread. Unable to recover my Court initiated PDF documents that they sent to my Comcast email, synced with TB on this Mac Monterey system, I made a last ditch effort to recover them through my Comcast account online, going through their website. So, despite any administrative mischief that the Court predisposed me to suspect, sort of virtual "lawfare," I was able to recover those documents directly through my online account. However, this makes it less worthwhile to have a default email account - and considering that I also have Windows 10, which no longer supports its Mail app, careful research substantiated that TB was the best replacement. So, there is some kind of problem with TB if it either cannot retain these attachments, or it is subject to some third party who wants to corrupt them after they transmit them. Where is the problem, TB or the sender?

title: How to narrow down disappearing mail problem
creator: daniel352
content:
I recently hat some issues with one of my accounts. At first some random mails disappeared right after receiving them, which made me question my sanity. Last week, I was able to witness a mail being recieved, appearing in search results, disappearing in the client and disappearing the mail from the server about a minute later.

While I was still wondering about this and looking for solutions (I tried the "Repair Folder" last week), I found no apparent changes, until yesterday, when about 9 months worth of emails turned into thin air. (Not in the inbox, not in the trash, not in the archive or on the server). Fortunately our IT department has backups and could also confirm my suspicion that the deletion was issued from Thunderbird.

I think there is a severe bug somewhere, but at the current moment I don't have the smallest clues to write a useful bugreport. Where would you start collecting evidence for this?

(Running Thunderbird, version=128.6.0, on Windows10, when this happened)

Thanks, Daniel

title: Nuovo account con Thunderbird
creator: Lucio.Sibilia
content:
Spett. Supporto Mozilla,

avevo un account Thunderbird molti anni fa, ma poi sono passato ad usare il server della mia università (uniroma1.it) e in seguito quello dei docenti in pensione (fondazione.uniroma1.it) . Nel corso del tempo, le regole per l'uso di quest'ultimo server si sono fatte sempre più restrittive, al punto che adesso non lo posso più usare per prenotare biglietti di nessun tipo perché le informazioni di conferma da parte dell'emittente vengono filtrate dall'università.

Ho quindi deciso di reinstallare Thunderbird, ovviamente alla versione attuale e con questo crearmi una nuova casella di posta (all'indirizzo lucio.sibilia@crpitalia.eu) che non sia più soggetta alle politiche accademiche. Il mio problema è duplice ora che avrei bisogno di una nuovo account di posta: 1. vorrei recuparare le impostazioni che avevo con le vecchie caselle (ma non posso usare una casella con server uniroma1.it) 2. vorrei recuparare anche la rubrica (indirizzi email dei colleghi e altri contatti che ho usato finora).

Attendo qiundi suggerimenti. Grazie, Lucio Sibilia

title: Creating a New Mailing Group
creator: jim.d121
content: I can drag and drop some existing email addresses from my address book into a new mailing group, but Firefox refuses to allow other email addresses to be dragged and dropped. It seems completely arbitrary as to which existing email accounts can be drag and dropped and which cannot. The online "HELP" instructions for this function are completely outdated, written for an earlier version of the software, and are no help at all. The whole process of creating a mailing group that has several (30-40 or more) existing email addresses in it is a giant task if one cannot drag and drop those into the group. It is as if whoever designed the mail group function did not expect anyone to set up anything but small groups. Please fix this function!! It's current usability is severely limited and a real pain to use.
